com.eclipsesource.v8.utils

Class V8Executor

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.eclipsesource.v8.utils.V8Executor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class V8Executor
extends Thread
    Executes a JS Script on a new V8 runtime in its own thread, and once finished, will optionally wait on a message queue. If the executor is *not* long running, when the JS Script finishes, the executor will shutdown. If the executor *is* long running, the the script will execute, and when finished, the executor will wait for messages to arrive. When messages arrive, the messageHandler will be invoked with the contents of the message. Executors can be shutdown in two different ways. forceTermination() will stop any executing scripts and immediately terminate the executor. shutdown() will indicate that the executor should shutdown, but this will only happen once any scripts finish executing and the message queue becomes empty.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • V8Executor

        public V8Executor(String script,
          boolean longRunning,
          String messageHandler)
        Create a new executor and execute the given script on it. Once the script has finished executing, the executor can optionally wait on a message queue.
        Parameters:
        script - The script to execute on this executor.
        longRunning - True to indicate that this executor should be longRunning.
        messageHandler - The name of the message handler that should be notified when messages are delivered.

      • V8Executor

        public V8Executor(String script)
        Create a new executor and execute the given script on it.
        Parameters:
        script - The script to execute on this executor.

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        protected void setup(V8 runtime)
        Override to provide a custom setup for this V8 runtime. This method can be overridden to configure the V8 runtime, for example, to add callbacks or to add some additional functionality to the global scope.
        Parameters:
        runtime - The runtime to configure.

      • hasException

        public boolean hasException()
        Determines if an exception was thrown during the JavaScript execution.
        Returns:
        True if an exception was thrown during the JavaScript execution, false otherwise.

      • getException

        public Exception getException()
        Gets the exception that was thrown during the JavaScript execution.
        Returns:
        The exception that was thrown during the JavaScript execution, or null if no such exception was thrown.

      • hasTerminated

        public boolean hasTerminated()
        Determines if the executor has terminated.
        Returns:
        True if the executor has terminated, false otherwise.

      • forceTermination

        public void forceTermination()
        Forces the executor to shutdown immediately. Any currently executing JavaScript will be interrupted and all outstanding messages will be ignored.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Indicates to the executor that it should shutdown. Any currently executing JavaScript will be allowed to finish, and any outstanding messages will be processed. Only once the message queue is empty, will the executor actually shtutdown.

      • isShuttingDown

        public boolean isShuttingDown()
        Returns true if shutdown() or forceTermination() was called to shutdown this executor.
        Returns:
        True if shutdown() or forceTermination() was called, false otherwise.

      • isTerminating

        public boolean isTerminating()
        Returns true if forceTermination was called to shutdown this executor.
        Returns:
        True if forceTermination() was called, false otherwise.
